title: Representations - Connect f-f prime-f double prime

content.question: The graph of <math alttext="f prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a line in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The line slants downward and to the right. It crosses the y axis above the origin, and crosses the x axis to the right of the origin.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The curve begins above the x axis, to the left of the y axis. It moves upward and to the right until it reaches a local maximum at a point above the x axis and to the left of the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right, crossing the y axis above the origin, and crossing the x axis to the right of the origin. It continues downward and to the right until it reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis and to the right of the y axis. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends below the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The curve begins below the x axis, to the left of the y axis. It moves downward and to the right until it reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis and to the left of the y axis. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the y axis below the origin, and crossing the x axis to the right of the origin. It continues upward and to the right until it reaches a local maximum at a point above the x axis and to the right of the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends above the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The curve begins below the x axis, to the left of the y axis. It moves downward and to the right until it reaches a local minimum at a point far below the x axis and to the left of the y axis. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the y axis below the origin, and crossing the x axis to the right of the origin. It continues upward and to the right until it begins to level off. The curve continues almost horizontally for a short period of time before moving gradually upward and to the right again. It ends above the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The curve begins below the x axis, to the left of the y axis. It moves downward and to the right until it reaches a local minimum at a point below the x axis and to the left of the y axis. It then moves upward and to the right, crossing the y axis below the origin, and crossing the x axis to the right of the origin. It continues upward and to the right until it reaches a local maximum at a point above the x axis and to the right of the y axis. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends above the x axis.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
